description: EnvSt 281 Soil to Plate (ARTHUM)  Mark Allister In this course students study food and the local foods movement from soil to plate. Study takes place in and out of the classroom: students read the agricultural bill and Michael Pollan; watch documentaries about our national food issues and visit local farms; work with and on local farms to see how they do their business; and, as often as possible, cook and eat. Fine chefs welcome. Those who aren't will get some cooking lessons.
name: Top: Food: Soil to Plate
title: Topics in Environmental Studies
